definition: to hold/to contain/to grasp/to take hold of/handle/particle marking the following noun as a direct object/classifier for objects with handle/classifier for small objects: handful
bearer of ill luck/person with the evil eye/comet

sentences.english: Little Boys and Girls, Will You Come and Ride with Me on My Broomstick?
sentences.chinese: 小男孩和女孩，你们能一起来骑在扫把上飞嘛？

sentences.english: We get on these broomsticks and ride home.
sentences.chinese: 梅金挖苦道，“那我们还是骑着扫把回家吧。”

sentences.english: I am not going to be the only party poop here.
sentences.chinese: 我才不要作唯一的扫把星。

sentences.english: When I came to your first flight of stairs, the dustpan and the broom were fighting, and violently hitting one another.
sentences.chinese: 我在一楼看到扫把和铁锹又吵又打。

sentences.english: Could you take a broom to sweep the snow in front of her house for her?
sentences.chinese: 你能不能拿支扫把，帮老太太屋前的雪扫一扫？

sentences.english: The brooms were still bringing water into the castle.
sentences.chinese: 这些扫把仍不停地把水提进城堡里。

sentences.english: They usually wear pointed hatsand fly around on broomsticks.
sentences.chinese: 他们通常戴着尖顶的帽子，骑在扫把上飞来飞去。

sentences.english: The Rockets must be a bad luck charm for the Heat.
sentences.chinese: 火箭看来一定是热火的扫把星。

sentences.english: I know you mean well. But you are a bad karma.
sentences.chinese: 我知道你是好心，可你真是个扫把星。

sentences.english: Jane: I am going to take Academy Awards. Hoho.
sentences.chinese: 你不会是去参加奥斯卡拿“最佳扫把奖”的吧？

sentences.english: They usually wear pointed hats and fly around on broomsticks.
sentences.chinese: 他们通常戴着尖顶的帽子，骑在扫把上飞来飞去。

sentences.english: My Papas hair is like a broom, all up in the air.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸的头发像扫把，根根直立往上插。
